intro: Conospermum scaposum, commonly known as the slender conospermum, is a shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. Conospermum scaposum is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
